content.description: Begin problem at the large angled block 5 feet below the main cliff. Climb up this and onto the ledge that runs below the most of the face. From here, Climb straight up and into diagonal, right leaning crack that splits all the way up. Very tall, unprotected climb. If insecure about the bold climb, set up a rope. Beautiful quality however, and the climbing is easy.
content.protection: For top roping, set up a static line anchor to trees above the face.
content.location: Approach from the trail running 30 feet below the cliff. Walk straight up to slanted block leaning on the main cliff.

content.description: The rocks range from large cliffs to small boulders. Two dueling cracks directly in the middle of the face form the shape of Vermont. The rock is excellent, but the landings suck. Climb carefully. Can probably be top roped.
